dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, I'm thinkin' "Othello"  or...  "Soylent Green."  Lots of girls make a  smooth transition from pageants into  actin', y'know.

dialogues.text: CONNIE, mid-30's, Midwestern attractive, wearing a sash  and tiara, stands in front of a BLUE SCREEN of a FOREST. CONNIE

dialogues.text: Competin' for the title of Minnesota's  American Teen Princess sure was  excitin'.  But, I never coulda won  without my... PULL BACK to reveal a table full of PORK PRODUCTS.  CONNIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Paul Pork Products!

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL TV COMMERCIAL, (VIDEO)
dialogues.text: SCREEN CHANGES to OUTSIDE FACTORY/STOCK YARDS.  Connie  now wears a coat and hat and acts as if it's chilly. CONNIE (cont'd)

dialogues.text: I've been enjoyin' St. Paul Pork  Products for years.  I grew up right  next to these stock yards. SCREEN CHANGES to VIDEO of a SLAUGHTER LINE.  PIG  CARCASSES move on hooks.  Connie wears a hard hat and  blood stained butcher's apron. CONNIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still the same family-run  business that Walter and Vera Polarski  started in 1920 when they raised and  slaughtered their first pig. Connie grabs a HOT DOG from O.C. and takes a bite. CONNIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-mmmm.  I just love St. Paul Pork  Products.  In fact, I love kem so much

dialogues.text: SLIDE CHANGES to VIDEO of the SAUSAGE LINE.  Workers  stuff sausages.  Connie wears a white jumpsuit and  hairnet. CONNIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work here now!

dialogues.text: MRS. BETZ, a large woman, holds a tray of bars.  CREW  MEMBERS REACH IN THE SHOT and help themselves.  JANELLE  BETZ sits on the couch, SIGNING EVERYTHING she says. JANELLE (slow, due to signing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My talent will be an interpretive  dance while I sing, "Through the Eyes  of Love."  I have a dream of spreadin'  sign language around the world... Mom?   Would you be so kind?

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: JANELLE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well, see, uh, I have a dream  of spreading sign language around the  world. (to Mrs. Betz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, would you be so kind. Mrs. Betz quickly puts down the bars and goes to the  piano where she starts "Through the Eyes of Love."   Janelle begins to gesticulate and sign words in an overly dramatic performance that looks like a bizarre seizure.   SOUND occasionally DIPS OUT as the BOOM OPERATOR reaches  for bars.

dialogues.text: TAMMY CURRY - a cute, jock-type.  She wears a LETTER  JACKET, covered with VARSITY SPORTS PATCHES. TAMMY CURRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tammy Curry.  I'm signin' up for the  scholarship'n'all.

dialogues.text: I love that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you say you have a good chance  to win this pageant?

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: TAMMY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you bet I do.  I mean, maybe  other people think I can't win a  beauty pageant.  But other people  didn't think I could beat out Becky  Leeman for President of the gun club,  either.  And I did.  I-I-It's just  like Anthony Robbins says, "I'm a  winner.  Nobody can stop me but me!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABLOOM!  Tammy's John Deere thresher BLOWS UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON framed school photo of Tammy Curry.  PULL BACK  to see her letter jacket - scorched and torn (Lutheran  Gun Club patch is MISSING) - and flowers.  CONTINUE  PULLING BACK to reveal both are surrounded by buns, bars  and coffee on a long buffet table.  A line of somber and  repressed Lutherans help themselves to the food.   Servettes stand at the ready.  Gladys and Iris face the  camera. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, I think everyone's  doing really well considering the fact  that she was so young. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always hard to see the young ones  called home, especially on an  exploding thresher.  It's just so odd  and gross. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that sometimes it's hard to  understand God's great plan. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Iris pats Gladys on the shoulder. FEMALE MOURNER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have a tissue? GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the show must go on. (she faces Iris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get a hold of Ted and ask him  if we can use that barn light as a  spot again.  So you watch the Jell-o  salad, okay? IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's smokey as hell.  THREE "FRY" GIRLS and a PREGNANT  "FRY" GIRL - all with "shelf bangs" - smoke and drink. FRY GIRL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Oh, yeah-right.  I ain't gonna be  in no goddamn pageant!  Look what  happened to that dork-ass farm girl. PREGNANT FRY GIRL (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tammy Curry? FRY GIRL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-yah.  Everyone says this is a big  accident?  She got iced because she  wins everything, and this time someone  didn't want her to win. PREGNANT FRY GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This pageant's like a roach motel. FRY GIRL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls check in, but they don't check  out. PREGNANT FRY GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  And they say smokin' is bad for  your health. FRY GIRL #1 (raising cigarette into  frame)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: SIGN painted on GARAGE DOOR: "Dance Studio, Downstairs  past the Laundry Room." CAMERA moves DOWNSTAIRS to converted basement.  LISA  SWENSON and two other large "ballerinas" practice at a  2x4/ballet barre.  MOZART plays in the b.g.  CHLORIS  KLINGHAGEN watches and smokes.  (Picture Betty Davis in  her final days.) CHLORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tendu.  Close.  Tendu.  Close.  Tendu.  Close.  Plie.  And repeat.   Suck in the belly, girls, and tuck in  the tushes!

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: CHLORIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close those legs!  You look like a  bunch of bowlegged cows!  Other side.   And...tendu.  Close.  Tendu.  Close.   Tendu.  Close.  Plie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloris smokes and talks to camera.  "Ballerinas"  practice. CHLORIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you boys sure picked a good  year.  If I was a betting woman, and  there was a line on this in Vegas, I'd  lay down ten-to-one that it all comes  down to Amber Atkins and Becky Leeman.   Oh, sweet Jesus, what a showdown this  could be if Cain and Abel... The SOUND RECORDIST enters and Lisa spins out of control, taking him out.  She leans over and comforts him. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!  Oh, God.  It's so em-so  embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: "DAKOTA COUNTY EATING DISORDERS CLINIC"
dialogues.text: MARY (V.O.) (labored breaths)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My winning...the Mount Rose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMILING ANOREXIC GIRL sits in bed - a TIARA in what's  left of her hair and a SASH over her hospital gown. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...American Teen Princess Pageant...

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: MARY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...really changed my life. The TIARA SLIPS OFF her BALDING HEAD and rolls to the  floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber fixes Mary's hair, carefully brushing her balding  head.  Mary smiles, oblivious. MARY (labored breaths)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Amber does my hair...once a week. AMBER (flattered and embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...it's the least I can do for the  reigning Mount Rose Junior Miss Amer-- Amber pulls the brush away with a clump of Mary's hair  dangling from it. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Oh...Uh, just a little snarl... Amber mouths, "Shhh!  Don't tell!" to camera as she tries to pull the clump of hair from the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber ties the tiara and missing clump of hair to Mary's  head with a ribbon. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. She holds the mirror for Mary. MARY (delusional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful... Maybe next week... a  perm. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah... sure... Amber gives a kind but worried smile to camera.   Suddenly, Becky Leeman enters with a large box of  chocolates.  She's fully aware of the cameras from the  moment she enters. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellooo, Little Mary Sunshine! (pretending to notice camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  Oh-oh my God!  Lights!   Camera!  And me without a stitch of  make-up on.  What are you guys doin'  here? She's in full make-up. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin' here? BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Amber, like you're the only one  who visits Mary. MARY (to Becky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? BECKY (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Who are you?!"  Oh Mary, you kill me. (to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She always says that.  It's a little  game we play.  Every week - same dippy  little look on her face.  "Who are you  - who are you?"  Just like that. (in Mary's face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me - Becky - and I brought your  favorites. Becky puts the chocolates on Mary's lap, a few spill.   Throughout the following, Mary slowly reaches for them as if they're forbidden fruit and she's a very hungry Eve. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice, Becky, she's anorexic. Becky roughly puts her hands over Mary's ears, who's now  gently petting the spilled chocolates in her lap. BECKY (sotto, reprimanding tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's skinny, not deaf, Amber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE - Amber taps around the mobile home community,  HOME FROM SCHOOL - backpack, Walkman, cool music blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber stands in a room the SIZE OF A CLOSET.  Posters,  articles and pictures of great tap dancers and Diane  Sawyer cover the walls. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Dreams?  Yah-sure I got kem...  Sometimes I dream of winnin'... I  dream of gettin' outta Mount Rose and  bein' a big time reporter like Diane  Sawyer.  I mean, guys get outta Mount  Rose all the time for hockey  scholarships or prison.  But the  pageant's kinda my only chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber points to LARGE PAGEANT PHOTO OF DIANE SAWYER -  1963 AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yah-1963.  Her beauty worked  against her when she started as a  reporter in Louisville, her hometown.   Those were different times. ANNETTE (O.S.) (yelling, coughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Amber, y'get my smokes? AMBER (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my mom. (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get kem in a sec. ANNETTE ATKINS, Amber's mom - sexy, but tired - OPENS THE DOOR. ANNETTE (surprised by cameras)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're from L.A.  They wanted to see  my room and film me for their movie. ANNETTE (mock-touched, to crew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... How quickly they grow up. (exiting, smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if they ask you to take off your  shirt, get the money first. Annette is gone. ANNETTE (cont'd) (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And go get my smokes!

dialogues.speaker: LEEMAN FAMILY HOME
dialogues.text: Landscaped grounds surround this lovely two-story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brief "LIFESTYLES OF THE RICH & FAMOUS" montage of Gl showing off interiors to the theme from "GONE WITH THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a Levitz showroom.  Gladys sits stiffly  between Becky and her husband, LESTER - mid-60's, gruff,  "old school" salesman, drink in hand. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You betcha.  S'posed to be colder-n- a witches tit tonight... GLADYS (nervous laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lester.  He loves his weather,  y'know. LESTER (looking to crew, O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, ya like it?  Open it...Yah-the  globe.  Pull at the equator there. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not in the showroom, Dear. Banging and fumbling.  A CORKSCREW flies into shot - CREW GUY quickly ENTERS SHOT and grabs it. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fits three full-size booze bottles.   The cassette deck pulls outta  Afghanistan, there. BECKY (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommm... GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester? LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, all right (to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon they forget where all this  comes from. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Japan. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, young lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Impartial?"  Outside this house I'm  Gladys Leeman, President, Civil  Servettes - impartial as the day is  long.  But we're inside my home now  and I've gotta warn you, I'm wearin'  my "wife apron" and "mom hat."  So, I  can safely say that I'm the mother of  the most talented contestant Mount  Rose has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester's gone from the couch. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll field that one - Rebecca's saving  her voice. Becky smiles admiringly at Gladys. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You-betcha, Rebecca's ready.  She's  been singin' and dancin' since she was  knee high to a pig's eye. Lester returns to the couch, large drink in hand. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-she's damn near as good as that  little black fella - with the glass  eye. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy Davis, Jr., honey. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, the Jew. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice one, Dad.  He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same scene.  BOYS' WRESTLING TEAM - tight singlets - runs laps around gym - between Servettes and camera.   GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yah-then, for the "Judges  Interview," each girl has a ten minute  get-together with the judges before  the pageant... Gladys is distracted by the HARD, YOUNG bodies.  All are. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the Judges Interview.. Each girl  has a ten minute get-together with the  judges prior to the pageant.  Then we  have the... A HUNKY WRESTLER, TONY, waves. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Tony. TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hey" to the folks. TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, all right. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judges Interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN DOUGH - pharmacist, 30-ish, thin, nervous - chain  smokes outside the drugstore.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've, uh, you've judged a lot of  pageants over the years? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  No.  Uh-uh.  Never judged a  pageant before in my life.  Nope.  No  way.  Never around young girls.  Even  if I was, why would I wanna be,  y'know?  I-I-I don't get off on that  kinda thing and that's really why  you're askin', right?  S-someone say  somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD - owner, late 40's - stands in front of this  grubby little store front with his MILDLY RETARDED  BROTHER, HANK, who SNIFFS and MUMBLES CONSTANTLY.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you judge the pageant every year? HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nope.  Never judged nothin' afore --  HANK (pointing at camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we on "Cops?" Are we on "Cops?"  Are we on "Cops?" HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Hank.  This here's business. Harold CUFFS Hank. HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, Harold - Mom said not the head. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mom's dead, so shut your fly  trap. HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will if you shut your piehole. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me kick-ya where the good  Lord split-ya. Harold raises his hand, Hank FLINCHES and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you excited? HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Oh you betcha!  We're happier than  the day Hanky got acquitted.  I get  made a judge, then the furniture store  hires us to paint the whole damn  thing. (removing cap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna use the money to get our  mamma a proper headstone.  Oh, and  move her out to the cemetery. Suddenly, Hank runs full speed into the window.  BAM!  He falls to the ground inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow Lester around cheesy room displays.  JEAN KANGAS,  his meek, middle-aged secretary follows him everywhere.   Lester CALLS OUT to a YOUNG COUPLE sitting in a dining  room. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Tim, Carla - if yous kids don't  try to Jew me down none, I'll throw in  a matchin' hutch. The COUPLE smiles excitedly. LESTER (cont'd) (to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that there's my specialty.  Don't  pay me less and I'll give ya more.  (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret is, the hutch is included in  the price.  Ain't that right, Jean? Lester smacks Jean on the ass. SUPER: JUDGE #3, JEAN KANGAS. LESTER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a memo, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contestants run out the side door as if running on stage. Tess Weinhaus trips and falls, causing a chain reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now contestants run out carrying small wooden step  ladders.  As they reach the CHORUS LINE, they set the  ladder down and LEAP FROG over.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: CHLORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four, five, six, seven.  And one. Tess runs out, sets her ladder down, jumps and hits mid- crotch.  She then slides painfully down to the ground. CHLORIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that chair away!  Get it!  Come  on!  Get it! Amber TWIRLS perfectly. CHLORIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Let's got.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS NEIGHBORS' sitting in lawn chairs, enjoying  the music and the show.  END ON JOHN DOUGH, leaning  against his car, smoking and holding a video camera at  his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN row doing a seated chorus line on ladders.  Most suck.  Amber and Becky look great.  Tess sits on the  grass with a bag of ice on her crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On John Dough, beside his car. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just out here watching the young  girls - contestants - like the rest of  my friends and neighbors... John quickly turns and starts to pry the hood open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat and Brett watch the girls.  Pat admires Amber's  moves. PAT (re: Amber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gettin' her?  Uh, the third  one, the blonde one. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. PAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  Right over there.  Right over  there. Brett slaps Pat on the back. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, leave him alone.   It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, his car hood open, is caught aiming his video  camera at the girls performing a dance.  They wear  partially constructed U.S. Monument Headdresses.   JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is just a...camera.  I keep  it in the glove compartment for car  accidents.  Insurance... You guys got  a camera and no one's accusin' you of  anything, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move through kitchen.  LUNCH LADIES haul, serve and  prepare food.  Pan over to Amber, who's unhappily  scraping and spraying lunch trays as they're dropped off  at her window.  Becky, flirting her ass off, comes to the window with Brett, handsome football player we saw  before.  Both carry trays. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Brett, do you wanna go to the lake  with me on Thursday? BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, actually, I got practice on  Thursday. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yah-well, maybe Friday, then.  A  bunch of us were gonna go cow-tippin'.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL TEAM
dialogues.text: BRETT (seeing Amber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I-uh-I'm kinda busy Friday. Amber looks up to see Brett looking at her.  He smiles.   She smiles.  You can feel the attraction.  Amber becomes  girlishly self-conscious -- adjusting her rubber apron  and brushing hair out of her eyes with her big rubber  gloves. BRETT (cont'd) (to Amber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Becky notices their attraction and goes from flirt to  uber-bitch in a heartbeat. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giver her your tray, Brett.  You're  holdin' up the line. Brett looks at Beck, then at Amber, not wanting to make  her clean his tray. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to her! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I'll take it.  It's my job. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: NO...
dialogues.text: (looking at Becky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.  I got it.  Don't  worry about it. He takes the sprayer from a surprised Amber and starts to clean off his own tray.  Becky can't believe his  defiance. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're supposed to put it in  the... Becky THROWS her tray on the counter spraying Amber with  food as she storms off. BRETT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, you got leutefisk in your  hair. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it must be Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same scene as "funeral bun" explanation. IONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leutefisk is Cod Fish that's been  salted and soaked in lye for a week or  so.  It's best with lots-a butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same scene.  Brett removes the offending leutefisk. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, I-I'm not really busy Friday.   I just said that - y'know. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if, uh, you wanted to do  somethin'... AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBER/BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huntin' season. Shocked at the coincidence, they share a laugh. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, I'm cuttin' out early today  to do a little duck huntin'...but, uh,  maybe I could call you tonight. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-sure, fine...fine. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...well, bye. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Amber smiles, gives a shy little wave - then, to camera. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God - you don't think Becky saw  you guys, do you? (nervously looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you just shouldn't be in here... DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  Doreen gave us hair nets. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen. (whispering as she exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't talk here.  Stop by my  house tonight, okay? She looks around and motions them to rush off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the CREW VAN we pass the crappy trailer homes that  are off the Highway.  (Patsy Cline's "King Of The Road"  PLAYS on the radio).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera approaches the trailer.  SIGN on the door reads  "Annette's Family Hair Care." Inside, the kitchen has been turned into a mini hair  salon.  Annette gives Loretta, neighbor, mid-50's - a  bouffant. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, they take out her  butt? ANNETTE (seeing camera in window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus H. Christ! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we on "Cops" again? ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be quiet. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the guys that are...you  know, makin' the movie about the  pageant.  I told you about kem. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, naw.  Hi. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here's Loretta. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell Annette, I says, "You talk to  me durin' my stories, you might as  well be talkin' to the wall." (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want a beer? DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.  Is Amber here? ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You just missed her.  Amber got  called in to the bone gardens tonight.   You just missed her.  She's in a  helluva mood today, anyways. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, yous boys been to the Leeman's? ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta, shut it. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, if you have, you got all the  pictures of the winner you need. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it up, Loretta. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ, it's true. Annette begins to comb out Loretta's hair. LORETTA (drinking beer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say who should win, who  deserves to win is Amber. ANNETTE (mumbled to self)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you paint a big red target  on your ass, Loretta. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the prettiest, y'know.  The best  damn tapper.  The most smartest... ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Most smartest?"  Oh, that's good,  Loretta.  Make sure you get a picture  of that.  "Most smartest."  We're  cuttin you off and sendin' you home. Annette takes Loretta's beer, starts to push her out. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, excuse me, Annette, but I'm  braggin' up your kid, here. (to crew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber's gonna be the next Diane  Sawyer, y'know... ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.  See ya later. CAMERA follows Annette and Loretta. ANNETTE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're makin' a movie, here, goddamn  it. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, they're makin' a movie. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know where this is gonna... LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a hairdo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta holds onto the door frame so Annette can't push  her out. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think that Becky's  going to win? LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I think Becky'll win?  You're  talkin'... (to Annette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pinch!. (back into camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talkin' kbout the richest  family in a small town.  It's front  page news when one of kem takes a  shit. (she laughs hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can one of yous boys give me a ride  home? ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fall for it.  She lives two  trailers down. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  Be real easy. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on home, Loretta.  Come on.  Go on,  the party's over. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small sign on the door reads: "EMBALMING - Please  Knock!" PUSH INTO ROOM.  Amber, back to us, frantically applies  blusher to an OLD WOMAN.  Another BODY, covered with a  white sheet, is on the embalming slab.  The top and brim  of a HUNTING CAP can be seen.  She TURNS AROUND to see  the crew. AMBER (cont'd) (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!  Je-sus-Christ-on-a-cross! (catching breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, number one rule in a funeral  home - never sneak up on the livin'.   You never know who could have an  embalming needle or skull saw in their  hand.  Mr. Larson's son learned that  the hard way - he's buried next to my  Grandpa! Amber turns to the slab to continue working.  She pulls  off the SHEET to reveal BRETT, handsome football player,  still wearing his hunting plaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBER (covering real emotions)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upset about Brett?  Nah.  Hazard of  the trade.  I don't really have time  for guys anyways.  It's weird, though.   He took it right between the eyes.   Don't often see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky thumbs bullets into a 12-gauge pump shotgun. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know, Brett just got shot in  the head. BECKY (cool as a cucumber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did?  Well, huntin's  dangerous...So, anyways, my mom gave  me this 30-aught for my sixteenth  birthday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber wipes her eyes when Mr. Larson bursts in. MR. LARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber, I need Stella now!

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: MR. LARSON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family's steamin' like a cow pie  in July.  Said she didn't look nothin'  like the picture they gave you. Amber turns from Brett and closes the coffin. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  I just thought she might not  wanna meet her Maker lookin' like a  cheap whore. MR. LARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your "cheap whore" is this  family's "lovin' mother." (pointing at Brett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clemens said to make him look like  he just came from snowmobilin'.  Pink  cheeks, and... AMBER (starting to mist up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- red nose and ears.  I know, I know. Mr. Larson PULLS Stella's coffin out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An obviously upset Amber puts make-up on Brett. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I couldn't talk today  kcause...I'm scared, okay? (deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I open my locker right after first  period and there's a picture of Tammy  Curry taped inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber holds up a snapshot of a SMILING GIRL on a  THRESHER. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was written on back. She turns the picture over to reveal, "YOU'RE NEXT!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWIN OFFICERS lean against their car.  One prepares to  pack some snuff. TWIN OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-yah, helluva way to go, there.   After some extensive investigation, we  figure the Curry girl musta been  drivin' and smokin' and KABLEWEY! TWIN OFFICER #2 (holding a Skoal tin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough left of her to fill a tin. He puts a pinch between his cheek and gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A visibly upset Amber still applies make-up to Brett. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-sure, Tammy liked to driver her  dad's thresher - she said the heavy  vibration helped her think, y'know?   But I know for a fact she only smoked  after a good drive.  You ask me or  anyone else who isn't scared to talk  about it - Tammy was murdered. (holding back tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I bet Diane Sawyer never had to  deal with crap like this... (to crew guy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toss me "Caucasian #5," would ya? A crew guy walks IN FRAME and hands her a make-up jar. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I can't wait for fishin'  season... Mr. Larson bursts in, white as a corpse. MR. LARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber... AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't say it.  Another stray  bullet to the head. She adjusts Brett's red plaid hunting cap. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need more caps. MR. LARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hafta go home.  There's some kinda  emergency at the trailer park. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, that's my ma's code for, "Bring  home milk and a carton-a Luckys." MR. LARSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Loretta called.  There's been  a... a fire. She grabs the keys and RUNS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber drives fast and furious as we come to what's left  of her trailer.  All the NEIGHBORS are out drinkin'  beers, eatin' food and watchin' the excitement. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God - no!  Is my mom okay?  Was  she home? Hearse SCREECHES to a halt.  We hear a THUD, then MOANS  from in back.  Amber jumps out.  Camera follows, a la  "COPS."  It's pandemonium with fire trucks, neighbors, an ambulance, etc. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!  Mom!?  MOMMMM! Loretta runs up to Amber as TWO FIREMEN approach. FIREMAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You family? LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's just screamin' "Mom, Mom!"  kcause she's got Tourettes... She's  Annette's kid, dipshit. AMBER (to Loretta)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mom okay? LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's alive, sweetie. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right over there. Camera pans over to see a semi-conscious Annette as they  load her stretcher into the ambulance, shut the doors and start to pull away.  Amber runs after them. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommmm!  I'll be right behind you in  the hearse! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let that worry you, Annette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR, Amber and Loretta stand beside Annette, who's  got an I.V., bandages and her LEFT HAND wrapped and  ELEVATED. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, doctor, is this sort of an unusual  injury here? DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you betcha, this was a doozy.   Right now, our chief concern is to  stabilize Annette, then, in surgery,  remove this here. Removing BANDAGE to reveal BEER CAN, still held in her  hand. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mom, it's so ugly. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruined a brand-new pair of Lee Press- ons. (weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I sat down for a beer and KA- BLEWEY!  Next thing I know, somethin'  blows through my kitchen window.  Next  thing I know, I'm ass up in Loretta's  flower bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAKY VIDEO of a 15 year-old rocker KID from the NECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCKER KID #1 (Beavis with a MN accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-dude, put another fuckin' book  under it. ROCKER KID #2 (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say "fuckin'." My ma's got the  windows open. CAMERA MOVES, then steadies.  We see all of Rocker Kid  #1.  Rocker Kid #2 runs into the shot with his guitar. ROCKER KID #2 (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: kKay-dude, hurry.  We gots like two  fuckin' minutes left on the battery. ROCKER KID #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A one...two...one-two-three... SUDDENLY Annette's' trailer EXPLODES behind them!  Rocker Kids turn to see a BODY (Annette's) FLY through the air. ROCKER KIDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNETTE (to Amber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shoved your tap shoes in my jeans  before I was blown outta the house,  Honey.  Check with the guy who cut my  pants off.  He should have kem. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, uh, about that...I-I'm-oh God... Amber starts to cry and runs out. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-Jesus-Mary-n-Joseph, she's  pregnant! (calling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are - come back, sweetie.   Mommy wants to talk, then KILL YOU! LORETTA (running after Amber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annette, why don't you just see if  there's any beer left in that can and  relax a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta and Amber face off. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what?! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I'm quittin' the pageant. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you, I was just tryin' to  scare you into changin' your mind.  Oh  for Chrissakes, Amber, the woman clung  to your tap shoes while flyin' through  the air like a Goddamn lawn dart! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I'm dead... A candy striper approaches them. CANDY STRIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, lil' Miss Sad-pants and her  friend Serious Sally, how kbout some  nice cool mints to turn those frowns  upside-down. "S." LORETTA (to candy striper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'ya think a nice cool mint'd help if  I shoved your head up your ass? Fear sweeps over the Candy Striper - she bolts down the  hall!  Loretta puts an arm around Amber and starts to  walk down the opposite direction. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do I say? LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple.  Just say, "Mom, I know you  sacrificed everything - relationships,  dreams - your tummy, ass and thighs -  all to bring me into this world.  All  so I could have tap lessons and be in  the pageant - the same one you were  in.  But, y'know what?  I'm quittin'."   There.  Easy as pie. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  I'm so dead... LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you betcha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow Amber in past the now crying candy striper. ANNETTE (throwing mints)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on!  Get out!   AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, look, don't say anything.  First  of all, I'm not pregnant. Amber sits on the bed.  Annette grabs her shirt. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't lettin' go ktil you tell me  what's up.  I'm reaching' a point  where I'd kill someone for the  nicotine on their fingernails. AMBER (deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Yesterday I...I got this  picture.  So I kinda, y'know, I'm  thinkin' no.  I'm gonna, I-I-I'm gonna  quit the pageant. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! She hits Amber with her beer-canned hand. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! ANNETTE (to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would yous boys excuse us a second?   Loretta, you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT THROUGH the window.  Amber paces around Annette's  bed. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice mouth you got there, Mom, but I- I'm not goin' through this again. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not goin' through this again?   You?  You're not the one who knows how  Jiffy Pop feels. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon... First the picture of  Tammy, then Brett Clemens, now this?   It's scary. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you "scary," Amber.  Look  at me.  Do you wanna look like you  been rode hard and put away wet at my  age?  I'm a "lifer" here.  Best I can  hope for is to end up in a descent  "raisin ranch" where they'll change me  twice a day. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, I'm goin'... ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest to God, if I got to do it over?   I'd start walkin' outta this town the  minute I took my first step.   Practically the only thing I wouldn't  do different is have you... Amber sits on the bed. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God I hope that's you and not your  concussion talkin'. ANNETTE (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me...I just don't want this to be  the thing you'd do over.  This  pageant's your ticket outta here.  I  know you can win, Amber. ANNETTE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere.  I love you so much. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you much. Annette hugs Amber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow a jubilant Amber and Loretta. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell-no, she ain't quittin'. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Mom said if I did, she'd look up  my dad and marry him. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So has your mom kept your dad's life a  secret? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  She never hid the fact that my  dad picked his career over us.  What'd  she used to say? LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Once a carnie, always a carnie." AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-yah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twin officers lean against their car. TWIN OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Atkins fire?  Foul play?  Shit-no.   After some thorough investigatin', we  determined it musta been a bad wirin'.   Mosta them trailer-folk plug a TV,  VCR, crock pot and Fry-daddy into one  outlet and don't think nothin' of it  ktil KABLEWEY! TWIN OFFICER #2 (taking a pinch of Skoal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough left to fill a tin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annette is in bad shape. The candy striper nervously  stands beside her, holding a syringe. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bad wirin'?!"  Well, if that ain't  the biggest crock-a-shit ever. (turning on the candy  striper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooowwww-Jesus!  Did K-Mart have a sale  on dull needles? CANDY STRIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I just need one more "do-over." EXT. MOUNT ROSE V.F.W. Follow the contestants up to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smokey room with DRUNKEN VETS at the bar and  CONTESTANTS, in Sunday best, crowded around some tables. They couldn't seem more out of place.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, remember the three most important  parts of a good interview... IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody, listen up! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number one, American Teen Princess'  don't cross their legs like  streetwalkers. The girls put their knees together. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss Penthouse Ninety- eight, put your knees together. (contestants laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could drive a boat show in there. Gladys paces. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ankles together.  Hands resting  lightly on your laps.  Good.  Sit up  straight.  Smile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Number two: the judges are  as nervous as you are.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: JUDGES - HAROLD, JOHN and JEAN KANGAS (Lester's  secretary) sit at a table, clipboards in front of them,  STARING at the camera.  HANKS sits behind them,  fidgeting. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you about ready to start the  judging - start the interview, there? JOHN (after long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I-I guess I could answer that.   Yep.  We're ready.  So, we should  probably get the young girls in here,  then.  Y'know, to start the  interviews...

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: Tess enters, sits, then quickly remembers how to sit.   Judges nervously look at their clipboards - pencils  ready. HAROLD (trouble reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, "if you could be any tree in the  woods, what kinda tree would you be?" TESS (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogwood.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON MOLLY HOWARD, seated. MOLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonsai.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON LESLIE, seated. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green?

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON MICHELLE JOHANSON, seated. MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tree?  I can be any tree you want.   Gimme a minute. She begins vocal and facial warm-up exercises.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON BECKY, seated. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One with strong roots in a community  like Mount Rose, a solid Christian  trunk and long leafy branches to  provide shade for handicapped kids on  a hot summer day.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON LISA SWENSON, seated, staring for a long beat, then: LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys know the retard's pants are  open? (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see that.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON THE JUDGES - Harold reads, John stares longingly. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Who would you pick to be president,  dead or alive?" PAN OVER to Molly Howard. MOLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Emperor Hirohito.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON LESLIE, seated... LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brett Favre!

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: ON BECKY, seated. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother, kcause she could solve  world hunger with one of her blue- ribbon rhubarb pies, create world  peace with one of her prayers and  still find time to look  beautiful...for my dad, Lester Leeman.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: John Dough drinks nervously from his water glass. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D-do you like to swim? The other judges look at him, then at their clipboards  trying to find this question.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA SWENSON
dialogues.text: LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-yah, I love to swim.  When I was in  New York, I met Greg Louganis at one-a  my brothers' shows...

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: Janelle, sings a long answer.  The Judges look at each  other confused and frustrated. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is she trying to say? (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it! JANELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ktards pants are completely off! The Judges turn and look at Hank. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up shop.  Close up shop, Hank. HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold! HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up shop!

dialogues.speaker: ON HAROLD
dialogues.text: HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Amber Atkins? AMBER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes I am.  Thank you, hello. All judges turn a page on their clipboards. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Name and spell all the United States  in alphabetical order." PAN OVER to a stunned Amber. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously? HAROLD (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah-yep. Amber can't believe what she's hearing. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ah...Alabama.  A-L-A-B-A-M-A.   Alaska.  A-L-A-S-K-A.  Arizona.  A-R-I- Z-O-N-A.

dialogues.speaker: V.F.W.
dialogues.text: AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West Virginia.  W-E-S-T-V-I-R-G-N-I-A.   Wisconsin.  W-I-S-C-O-N-S-O-N.   Wyoming.  W-Y-O-M-I-N-G.  Pan over to Judges.  They can't believe it.  Hank CLAPS  retardedly.  He loves her. HAROLD (looking at others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-okay, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE now stands beside Mary. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With two weeks until the pageant... (continued labored breaths)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was practicing my talent.  Finishing  my costume, brushing up on current  events, and running eighteen miles a  day on about four hundred calories.  I  was ready. The nurse gives her a hit of oxygen.  Mary smiles and  gives a THUMBS UP from behind the oxygen mask.

dialogues.speaker: DRESSING ROOM
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN long, narrow room.  A counter, with mirrors and  bare bulbs, cover one wall.  Girls set up their areas and change into their talent costumes.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coupla things...Gladys wants to be  sure we go in show order today.  All  right?  So very important.  Don't  forget that.

dialogues.speaker: DRESSING ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON LESLIE MILLER, in cheerleading uniform, standing beside small framed photos of her boyfriend on the  counter. LESLIE (unusually serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-yah, really nervous.  It's been  about two months.  I haven't told my  boyfriend yet.  How did you know? DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant, nervous about the pageant? LESLIE (suddenly perky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  Nervous about the pageant!  Yah  sure!   She kisses a photo and GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: DRESSING ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON BECKY holding a sequin-covered poodle skirt and  sweater. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are eight thousand sequins and  fifteen hundred beads on the skirt,  alone.  My mom and Mrs. Lopez make it.   She's one of my father's many Mexican  (Me'hee'kan) workers he lifts from the  poverty they know in Mexico  (Me'heek'koe).

dialogues.speaker: DRESSING ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON AMBER ATKINS at the far end of the counter. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-my ma's clothes all melted onto  mine forming like this big polyester  meteor in our closet, y'know?  But, in  some kinda weird miracle, our neighbor  boy, Kenny Johanson, found my tap  costume on the roof-a their trailer  while he was settin' coon traps for  his dad.  Here's the weird part.  It  was still on the hanger.

dialogues.speaker: DRESSING ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON TESS WEINHAUS wearing "I love German Shepherds"  sweatshirt, standing beside various trinkets. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, uh, this is my lucky bolt.  They  think it fell from a DC-10.  The  doctor said I was lucky the flat side  hit me, um, otherwise it coulda gone  right through my head. (holds up red tap dress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, gives me the willies,  too.  I guess the explosion... Janelle Betz, wearing a flowing, nymph-like dress with  ballet slippers, glides up to Amber. JANELLE (slow, due to signing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber?  Can we switch numbers?  I need  to go first. (smiling to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin just had a deaf baby and I  get to go see it! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-sure, eight's my luck number  anyway.  Diane Sawyer was number eight  at her local. JANELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON STAGE "Through the Eyes of Love" plays as Janelle  performs her INTERPRETATIVE DANCE while signing the  words.  In the f.g., Gladys appears very serious. GLADYS (loud whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be honest.  This is a hard time  for me.  This is the part of the  pageant when you realize that tomorrow  night, all but one of these girls will  walk out of here a loser.  It's hard  for me to know how that must feel, but  I'm sure it doesn't feel good. In b.g., a BIG STAGE LIGHT FALLS on Janelle's head.   CRASH!  Gladys and CAMERA rush the stage.  "Through the  Eyes of Love" continues throughout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very shaken Amber paces. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it?  I was supposed to  go first.  I was contestant number  one.  That light was meant for my  head.  If Janelle hadn't wanted to  change numbers... God, I owe my life  to that deaf baby. Loretta enters, portable phone and drink in hand. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was your mom.  She wanted you to  have this. AMBER (taking drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Loretta? LORETTA (avoiding eye contact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You-betcha. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom wanted me to have this? LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up.  I thought it might help  you get some sleep. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta, never have kids. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well God-love-ya for thinkin' I still  could. Loretta pulls a bag out of a closet and hands it to  Amber. LORETTA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, your ma did want you to have  this since your other one got toasted  and all. Amber pulls out an ELEGANT GREEN GOWN. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...my...God!  It's just like Diane  Sawyer's!  kCourse it's not a size  ten, Diane was a little hippy back  then.  Oh, thank you!  Thank you!   Thank you! She hugs Loretta.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: BANNER: "Welcome to the Mount Rose American Teen Princess Pageant, sponsored by Sarah Rose COSMETICS."  The ENTIRE  TOWN is excitedly entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Howard and their daughter Tina, who's  embarrassed and continues to rant as they pass.  All  three wear T-shirts with MOLLY'S FACE on them. MR. HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Molly!  Go!  Number one daughter! Behind them Leslie Miller's boyfriend, PAT, and a group  of ROWDY GUYS approach.  PAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whooo!  Leslie kicks Teen Princess  ass!  Go Muskies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAGE IS DARK.  Crowd takes their seats.  You can feel  the electricity. We hear the TAPE of a DRUM ROLL.  SPOTLIGHT hits center  stage.  Gladys enters wearing a gaudy gown, takes mic.   Applause! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, welcome.  Okay, alright, now.   Is this for me or the gown? Laughter and applause trail off. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Mount Rose American  Teen Princess Pageant.  While every  contestant you'll meet tonight is  special and unique, they all have one  thing in common.  They're all "Proud -  to - be - an - American!" Wild applause!  Jazzy patriotic medley tape.  Gym doors  fly open and like a Felliniesque Vegas review,  CONTESTANTS enter wearing gowns and U.S. Monument  Headdresses.  They struggle to maintain balance as they  dance, moving only their arms, on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky, whose head is built like another president into  Mount Rushmore, is first at the mic.  (The "dance"  continues behind each contestant as she steps up to the  mic.) BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I chose Mount Rushmore, because to  live in a country where you can take  an ugly old mountain and put faces on  it, faces of great Americans, who did  so much to make our country super  great, well that makes me - Rebecca  Leeman - PROUD TO BE AN AMERICAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MONTAGE of OPENING NUMBER INTRODUCTIONS

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA SWENSON
dialogues.text: wearing a Statue of Liberty Headdress.  (It's a Barbie  Doll that holds an unlit birthday candle.) LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living in a country where Lady Liberty  keeps her flame burning bright. She reaches up with a lighter to light the candle. It's  hard to reach and won't light. LISA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeps her flame burning bright...

dialogues.speaker: ON LESLIE MILLER
dialogues.text: as she seductively strokes the sides of her Washington  Monument Headdress. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Washington Monument... Guys WHOOP and CHEER O.S. LESLIE (cont'd) (enjoying this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..makes me, Leslie Miller, proud to be  an American.

dialogues.speaker: ON AMBER ATKINS
dialogues.text: with a MAP OF THE U.S. HEADDRESS, dances up to the mic. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living in a country where no matter  who you are or where you come from,  you can grow up and become what you've  always dreamed of, makes me, Amber  Atkins, proud to be an American!

dialogues.speaker: ON MOLLY HOWARD
dialogues.text: wearing an Atomic Blast at Hiroshima Headdress. MOLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atomic power makes me, Molly Howard,  proud to be an Asian-American. As she steps away from the mic, Tess Weinhaus, wearing a  huge ball of twine headdress, dances up to the mic. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, this, uh, my Uncle Phil's World's  Largest Ball of Twine, in Bundy  Minnesota, makes me, um, it makes me  proud I'm American - I kinda  misunderstood the assignment. The ball of twine falls to the floor and rolls off the  stage, still attached at one end to her head.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Pandemonium!  Contestants change into their "Physical  Fitness" outfits.  (T-shirts with red flags, shorts)  Civil Servettes try to help.  A LARGE PICTURE of Janelle  Betz sits at her counter space. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay!  Listen-up.  Coupla notes  from last night's dress rehearsal. (off clipboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number one, Gladys says a coupla yous  are gettin' sexy with your hips durin'  the "Physical Fitness" routine... AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  My-my tap costume's gone. Commotion stops.  Becky continues to get ready. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Amber?  We're not puttin' on our  Talent costumes.   You need to put on your "Physical  Fitness" outfit.  And let's shake a  leg, ladies. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait.  It-it was here before the  openin' number...wait.  What am I  sayin'?  I should just ask you, Becky.   Where is it? Becky freezes, staring daggers at Amber. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.  Where is it? The other contestants slowly clear a path between them. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're gettin' at somethin', you  better just say it. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, you better be willin' to  back it up, kcause you're talkin' like  crazy. They start to slowly circle each other - a cat fight's  brewin'. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-oh, you bring me some of that  snotty attitude, Becky - bring it on. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as my mother says at Sunday  dinner, "Come and get it," bitch! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll "get it."  I'll "get it" all  right.  I might even take seconds. They're moving ever closer... BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want seconds, then I'll make  sure it's hot enough for ya. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch! IRIS (stepping between them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls!  Girls! BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your stringy-ass hair! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you! CREW GUY (O.S.) (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, don't stop kem now... BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're choking my, you fucking bitch! IRIS (putting hand over camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I-I don't think yous boys  should, uh, should be in here while  the girls are changin'. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate her! IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all do.  Now let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys is center stage. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-so how kbout a big round of  applause for last year's Mount Rose  American Teen Princess, in a farewell  performance.  Who could forget her lip- synching to "Don't Cry Out Loud," by  Melissa Manchester.  And here she is,  Mary Johanson! Applause!  Gladys exits.  TAPED MUSIC "It's My Turn."  A  NURSE pushes MARY JOHANSON out in her wheelchair,  complete with portable oxygen.  Mary wears a gigantic  black wig and silver gown which hangs off her boney body. She moves her lips to the words as the nurse pushes her  emotionally around the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contestants, in "physical fitness" outfits, wait outside  the double doors, holding freshly painted red, white and  blue step ladders.  Becky and Amber stare at each other  from opposite ends of the line. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, why don't we take up the  stepladders, all right?  For the  Physical Fitness number? BECKY (picking up her stool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're wet. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, my hands are stuck. MOLLY (sniffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I'm kinda dizzy from the fumes. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hold kem away from you so it  doesn't get on the outfits. (turning to Servettes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda mental retard paints step  ladders the morning of a pageant.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Hank is being pulled off stage by Harold.  Gladys adjusts her dress, frazzled. HANK (under throughout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here come the judge - pinch, pinch -  here come the judge - pinch, pinch -  here come the judge... GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back!  Get back, you total retard! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Hank! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, I'm okay - dress is fine.   I'm okay...well, our other judges are  Jean Kangas and John Dough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iris and Servettes go in the gym as Chloris Klinghagen  comes out. CHLORIS (loud whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening number looked, uh, good.   Solid.  But now you're gonna have to  actually dance, so... (holds up jar of Vaseline)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Put a dab of this on the old  choppers, ladies.  It'll help you  smile.  And when they're lookin' at  your teeth - God willin' - they won't  be lookin at your feet. Chloris gives Amber the jar and exits.  From the gym, we  hear TAPED PATRIOTIC MUSIC.  Contestants CHEER and run  in.

dialogues.speaker: "PHYSICAL FITNESS" ROUTINE
dialogues.text: As cuts of patriotic dance moves progress, the girls have more and more red, white and blue paint smeared on their  clothes, arms and legs. Amber's clearly the best. Taped music ENDS.  Contestants, covered with paint,  strike a final pose - sitting on ladders, standing,  kneeling.  Applause.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Contestants wait anxiously as they pass a can of  TURPENTINE and a RAG to remove paint from their arms and  legs. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, guys, I think we all got some.   You just take it off. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I didn't get any. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, have some. MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me another white one. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you guys, don't go int the  bathroom.  Tess blew chunks all over.  Man, she ate a big dinner. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she shoulda shoved that lucky  bolt down her throat for desert. Becky storms off. AMBER (sotto, to other girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the winner of the "Spirit" award  goes to... Girls laugh quietly.  Iris pulls a dazed and confused  Tess - beg wet spot on her shirt - through the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iris stands center stage, awkwardly holding the mic. IRIS (reading from notecard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'd like to take you back seventeen  years, when a peanut farmer was in the  White House, a group-a boys callin'  themselves kQueen' topped the record  charts and Gladys Leeman was Gladys  Wood and she was Mount Rose American  Teen Princess!" Gladys enters wearing sash, tiara and plaid culottes.   Applause.  A SLIDE is shown of her at 17. GLADYS (taking mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you.  You know, I won  the talent contest by sewing these  culottes, Butterick pattern 7-4-3-2.   Can you believe it?  They still fit! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a big ass then, she's got a  big ass now. GLADYS (pausing for applause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you.   Our next eontestant is ready, so let's  welcome her: Tess Weinhaus! APPLAUSE.  Tess is pushed on stage.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Amber paces.  ON STAGE Tess drones on at the mic. TESS (in the b.g. throughout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beagle is known for it's howl.   "Aaauuuuuhhhh."  The Pekinese has it's  own distinctive bark.  "Yip, yip,  yip."  Not to be confused with the  Chihuahua's, "Yap, yap, yap."  But  none can compare to the greatest bark  of all - the German Shepherd... AMBER (to camera, loud whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yah-it's just gone... (eyes welling up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I-I just wanna tap, y'know?   I'm not sayin' I'm the best, or that  I'd even win, but shouldn't I at least  get a chance to compete? (starting to sob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted my Mom to see me dance. CHLORIS KLINGHAGEN enters, small bag in hand. CHLORIS (loud whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber - Amber, c'mere. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mrs. K, I got so much Vaseline  on my teeth, I'm gonna be smilin' for  a year. CHLORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Here. Chloris pulls a simple BLACK LEOTARD from the bag. CHLORIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothin' special, but talent like  yours doesn't need to hide behind  sequins. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. K-- CHLORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... you're special and... Ah  hell, go out there and kick some  Leeman ass. Amber, overcome with joy, gives her a big hug. CHLORIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so hard, sweetie.  I heard  somethin' snap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON STAGE: Leslie Miller, in uniform, performs an  amazingly sexy cheer as TWO SINGLET-CLAD WRESTLERS  wrestle (One is boyfriend, Pat.). LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll him over -- (clap, clap, clap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay him flat (clap, clap, clap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pin his shoulders (clap, clap, clap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the mat (clap, clap, clap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll him over, lay him flat, pin his  shoulders, to the mat!  Yeahhhh! She JUMPS, KICKS and ends with SPLITS.  APPLAUSE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle Johanson is on stage, sitting on a stool,  wearing all black.  She smiles warmly.  Then, with one  sweep of her hand across her face, her smile drops.   She's dead serious. MICHELLE (without emotion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade in...Earth.  The year is two- thousand twenty-four.  The question on  everyone's mind:  What is...Soylent  Green? She sweeps her hand back across her face and she's "in  character," pained, near death, and overly dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Amber, now in the leotard, talks to Iris.  Michelle  performs from "Soylent Green" in the b.g. AMBER (loud whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Clark, why are you doing this to  me?  Why're you pretendin' you don't  know what's goin' on? IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber, I'm sorry.  I really am.  But  you know the rules.  All talent  costumes hafta be okay'd by Gladys  before the pageant. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, doesn't someone taking your  costume so you can't compete, overrule  that rule? IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  I-I don't make the rules. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, this... This is bullshit! IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber Atkins!  That is not American  Teen Princess language! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, kcause this isn't an American  Teen Princess Pageant - it's, it's  Nazi Germany! Amber storms off. IRIS (shaking head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do they get this stuff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS AMBER as she storms over to BACKSTAGE -  RIGHT where Gladys watches Michelle ON STAGE. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Leeman? GLADYS (turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I'm wearin' this costume.  I'm, uh,  I'm gonna do my talent tonight. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really - I don't think so. (suddenly aware of camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Amber, I hate to be the bearer of  bad news, but rules state that a  costume must be okay'd at least a week  in advance.  And this... (pointing to costume)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why we have the rule.  My  goodness gracious, I couldn't allow a  neckline this low on stage.  We have  kids in the audience. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you - I mean... It's not my  fault.  I-I... Please?  I didn't do  anything wrong... Amber starts to cry. MICHELLE (climaxing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why... I must say... (raising arm upward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soylent Green... is... people. She doubles over.  She's given it all.  APPLAUSE. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops, that's my cue. Gladys starts out on stage as Molly Howard, dressed like  a red, white and blue cowboy, runs up next to Amber.   She's twirling toy guns on her fingers. MOLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish me luck. AMBER (drying her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Molly. One of Molly's guns flies off her finger.  She goes to  retrieve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is line dancing, occasionally taking "pretend"  shots into the air.  It's incredibly repetitive and dull.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: As Billy Ray Cyrus' "Achy Breaky Heart" PLAYS in b.g.,  Carl, the janitor, sets plastic army figures on fire with a cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys is center stage.  Molly Howard walks off crying,  having just finished her routine.  POLITE APPLAUSE.   She's still spinning her guns, again one goes flying. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, top hat, tails, giant "I LOVE NY" button - and  others try to console a CRYING Amber.  Becky continues  singing O.S. LISA (arm around Amber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Amber... AMBER (can't catch breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I-I-I-, j-uh-j-uh-just wanted to  compe-e-e-e-ete. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is happenin'.  I  can't believe she said you couldn't... Getting an idea, Lisa starts to take off her jacket. LISA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber?  Here. AMBER (still sobbing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Here," wh-wh-what? LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My jacket.  Take it kcause, y'know, I  got my costume okay'd before the  pageant.  You can wear it. MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, Lisa, I wouldn't do this. LESLIE (to Lisa)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're never gonna let you perform  naked.  I asked. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, yous guys.  Look, Amber, I'm  not gonna win.  And let's be honest, a  family only needs one "Liza" and you  know Peter's got much better legs than  me. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents'd kill you. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh c'mon, I love kem, but you know  they only had me kcause Peter needed a  kidney. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lis, I want to, I really do, but...  Oh, I can't. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then do it for Peter.  Mrs. Leeman  used to call him a "skinny little fag"  when he'd bag her groceries.  He'd pop  his Nancy-belt if his old jacket  somehow, I don't know, got her back. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah? LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-you-beccha. Amber hugs her and takes the jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys guides Molly off the stage. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, it's with overwhelming pride that  I introduce contestant number six, who  also happens to be president of her  class - two years running - a member  of the honor roll and the new  President of the Lutheran Sisterhood  Gun Club - Rebecca Ann Leeman! STAGE GOES BLACK.  SPOT HITS BECKY, who sits at the edge  of the stage, holding a mic.  She's head to toe sequins  in her poodle skirt, sweater, saddle shoes, etc.  BECKY (talking over music)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how many of you know  this, but I've got a very special  fella in my life - that's right, I  do... And if nobody minds, I'd like to  sing a little song, just for him. SPOT FOLLOWS as Becky stands and walks center stage to  what appears to be a COVERED MANNEQUIN.  TAPED INTRO TO  "I Can't Take My Eyes Off You." BECKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just too good to be true.   Can't take my eyes off of you.  You'd  be like Heaven to touch.  I wanna hold  you so much.  At long last love has  arrived and I thank God I'm alive.   Becky removes the sheet, revealing a MANNEQUIN dressed  like JESUS as he appeared on the cross: long hair, beard, crown of thorns, loincloth.  The ARMS ARE STUFFED so they move freely.  (Hands of stigmata.) BECKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just to good to be true.  Can't  take my eyes off of you... Becky TALK-SINGS - a la William Shatner's "Rocket Man" -  and DANCES around the Jesus mannequin doing the jitter- bug, the twist and a slow dance (his arms on her  shoulders).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iris approaches Lisa who's given her outfit to Amber. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Lisa.  You're up next. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit.  And, uh, since my costume,  y'know, was okay'd a month ago?  I'm  givin' it to Amber. Amber breaks a smile. Taped music ENDS.  APPLAUSE.  Gladys, mic in hand, joins  Becky for a big hug. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
