dialogues.text: Boy, I'd hate to follow that.  Wow! Becky exits, pulling the wheeled Jesus behind her. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice of an angel, that one. Iris runs self-consciously out on stage, whispers in  Gladys' ear, then runs back off stage. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Uh, I was just told that contestant  number seven, Lisa Swenson, has quite  the pageant. CROWD REACTS. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, these things happen.  At any  rate, we still have one more  contestant - number eight, Amber  Atkins. Gladys exits.  A taped hip, hot DRUM BEAT starts.   Suddenly, Amber glides into CENTER SPOT.  (Now wearing  Lisa's costume, sleeves rolled up.)  Her feet burst into  an amazing routine.  The loud drum beats seem to fly from her hands and feet as they punctuate the rhythm.  There's no glitz, just unbelievable skill.  It appears effortless as she floats around stage.  Like watching Michael  Jackson moon walk for the first time, you can't take your eyes off her.  She concludes, center stage, with the  GREATEST THIRTY SECONDS OF HER LIFE.  The audience goes  WILD!  Amber takes bow after bow - they love her.  Gladys enters quickly, mic in hand. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, okay!  Well, now, it's  finally time to say good-bye to our  judges, so they can go make the  toughest decision of their lives. PAN TO JUDGES.  They look nervous as hell.  A relaxed  Hank sniffs from a paint soaked bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judges stare nervously at the camera - clip boards in  front of them.  Hank's LOUD BREATHING from the paint  soaked bag is obviously getting on John's nerves. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who get's the crown?  How are you  going to figure this all out? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we're gonna, y'know, compare  scores and uh, figure out a-a winner.   kCause we don't know the winner yet...  I mean, I-I don't know who Jean and  Harold picked.  No idea.  Did Gladys  send you in here? HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the winner!  I know the winner!   I know the winner! JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't!  Shut your goddamn  mouth, you son-of-a-bitch!! Nerves shot, John suddenly LAUNCHES himself across the  table at Hank. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut it!  You goddamn retard! Hank freezes, then starts to wail! HANK

dialogues.speaker: EE-AAAYEEEE-AAAAYOUIAAAEEEEEEEE
dialogues.text: HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Hankey here can't help it if  he was born crazier than a shithouse  rat! Hank stops crying and goes back to the bag. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For fuck's sake, why didn't ya leave  him with a sitter? Hank begins crying again. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real nice.  You know the sitter's  dead.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Girls, in gowns, sit in silence.  Becky and Amber sit at  opposite ends of the room.  There's obvious tension. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, anyone talk to Janelle? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-I brought her some flowers this  morning.  She's in the room next to my  mom.  She's super happy. Girls ad-lib SHOCK. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's happy? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why happy? AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- the blow to her head made her  deaf... Girls ad-lib "Oh, I see.  Okay-then." etc.  Another LONG  BEAT of SILENCE follows.  Becky gets up to re-touch her  make-up. BECKY (losing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good Lord!  What're they doin'?   Lettin' the retard count votes?! Contestants stare at her in shock.  Iris enters. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judges are back.  Gladys is center stage.  Girls enter  and form a line behind her.  TAPED AMERICAN MEDLEY  STARTS. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, everyone.  Judges.  Our  Second Runner-up and winner of a fifty-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taped fanfare.  Leslie bounds forward, grabs her trophy,  stands to one side.   PAT (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rule, Leslie! Audience laughs.  Leslie waves. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our next prize, a seventy-five dollar  scholarship -- Audience ad-libs amazement. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...will be awarded to the First Runner- up. Taped DRUM ROLL.  Contestants (except Becky) take hands. Iris gives Gladys an envelope and trophy. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the First Runner-up is - (opening envelope, face  drops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contestant number eight, Amber Atkins. Ad-lib audience shock and disbelief.  Contestants are  stunned.  Amber steps forward, humbly takes the trophy  and stands beside Leslie.  Audience finally quiets. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, the moment I know I've  been waiting for... Iris hands Gladys a LARGE TROPHY and envelope.  Mary  Johanson is wheeled out wearing sash and tiara. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a scholarship of five-hundred  dollars, courtesy Leeman Furniture,  and all expenses paid for next weekend  when she'll be competin' for the title  of Minnesota American Teen Princess... Taped drum roll.  Gladys opens the envelope. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our new Mount Rose American Teen  Princess is contestant number - ah  heck, she's my daughter - number  seven, Rebecca Ann Leeman! Polite audience applause.  Becky rushes forward.  Gladys  RIPS the tiara and sash off Mary, places them on Becky. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you so much!

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Loretta and Annette watch on. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELDERLY MAN/MAYOR, from earlier scene, enters and  sings to a tape as Becky takes her victory walk. ELDERLY MAN/MAYOR (tune of "Miss America")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Here she is, Our Mount Rose American  Teen Princess.  Look at her, doesn't  she look fine.  Our hearts swell big,  as we look at her.  Our Mount Rose  American Teen Princess."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBULANCE pulls up.  Mary Johanson, unconscious, slumped  in wheelchair, is brought out and put in.  Amber and  Loretta wheel Annette out.  Paramedics put her in, too. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was robbed. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Take her purse. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye mom. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was robbed. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber faces camera as ambulance pulls away. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mom's okay.  They're just givin'  her a ride back.  She almost blew  outta the back of Loretta's pick-up on  the way over. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God for bunge cords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBER (tearing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yah-well, at least, y'know, I got  to perform.  And Mom got to see me. (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess number eight only worked for  Diane Sawyer... Loretta puts her arm around Amber.  They walk off as  Leslie and Pat approach. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-hey, I'm Second Runner-up!  Whooo!   I got second place! PAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Lisa passes by with her parents.  They look pissed. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was worth it.  Amber shoulda  won. LISA'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell ya one thing.  Peter never  woulda pulled a shenanigan like that. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, y'know what, dad?  Y'know what?   Peter's gay! She runs off.  Her parents stop DEAD IN THEIR TRACKS. LISA'S FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON BECKY'S FACE.  Flashes illuminate it.  With each photo she changes her smile and expression.  She loves  this. PULL BACK to reveal two older men, with old-style news  cameras, flash pictures. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how does it feel to be the new  Mount Rose American Teen Princess,  Becky? OLDER MEN turn and look at camera, then take out a pen  and note pad. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's all happenin' so fast.   Goodness-gracious, it hardly seems  real, y'know?  I mean, I won!  I'm the  winner!  I'm going to State! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the winner and we're going to  state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry Girl #1 and Pregnant Fry Girl smoke. FRY GIRL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a surprise.  Gladys Leeman's  finally gonna go to State.   And she'll probably ride on Becky's  ass all the way to Nationals, too. PREGNANT FRY GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder how she's gonna fix that one.  DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ladies going to the parade  tomorrow? PREGNANT FRY GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  I think I'm like, due or  somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNT ROSE MAIN STREET
dialogues.text: Beautiful sunny day.  Lester talks to camera. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh.  Beautiful as a whore's ass  today.  Eh, boys? In the b.g., Gladys holds a bullhorn, clipboard and  points to a LARGE SWAN FLOAT. GLADYS (into bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Turn that float around.  You  think a swan's gonna swim ass first up  Main Street? LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-Gladys had me order that swan  special made from Mexico (Me'hee'koe)  in case Becky won.  I do a lotta  business with those people.  I always  offer to pay kem in tacos. (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoo, they love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entire town lines the road.  The Mayor and the Leman  family stand behind the red ribbon.  Parade PARTICIPANTS  are lined up behind them. MAYOR (into bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-hello-hello...shit!  How the fuck  do ya work this damn thing, huh?  Oh.   Welcome to our first ever American  Teen Princess Parade - which also  happens to be the unveiling of our new  sewer system! CHEERS!  Becky cuts the ribbon.  More CHEERS! MAYOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah-so, while Becky gets on her float,  then, any questions kbout the new  sewer?  Yah, Clem?

dialogues.speaker: THE PASSING PARADE
dialogues.text: - THREE FAT VETS, dressed as the Revolutionary War trio,  hold American, Minnesota and POW/MIA flags. - TWO BATON TWIRLERS stand in front of the Mount Rose  High School Band.  They play - way off key. - JUDGES wave from a convertible.  Hank, in passenger's  seat, struggles to get out.  His seatbelt prevents it. - TWO GRUNGY OLD CLOWNS smoke impatiently. - TWO FAT WHITE MEN, dressed as Indians, sit on scooters. - FAT MAN drives a riding lawnmower, pulling a flatbed  with A SPEEDBOAT and a FISHING CAMP GROUP. - FARMER pulls a goat with a sign: "Milk Me for $1.00" - A BRIGADE of tap dancing BASSOONISTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Hank pull over and park their truck.  Harold  quickly gets out, obviously in a hurry, slamming on a  pouting Hank. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this straight right now.  We  wouldn't have been late at all if it  wasn't for you.  HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to have the big bag of little  donuts. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get nothing, Hank, okay? HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get the big bag of little  donuts. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your paint can.  The next time  you drink window cleaner, I'm just  gonna leave it in ya. Harold rushes off for the parade, joining other folks  carrying baskets, lawn chairs and flags on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OVER to see Gladys helping Becky climb on the swan,  unaware of camera.  In b.g., DOCUMENTARY CREW interviews  Amber and Leslie on their convertible behind the swan  float. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Rebecca, you wanted it.  Now  get up there.  Ride it side-saddle if  you have to - like a horse.  C'mon,  now. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smells funny.  Like gasoline. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for chrissakes, everything smells  like that in Mexico. BECKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dress'll reek. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, little missy, this cost your  dad a pretty penny.  Now get your ass  up there and show me some teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber and Leslie, in gowns, look unhappy as they stare  straight ahead, exhaust fumes - that appear to come from  the swan's ass - cover them and their old convertible. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber, if I die from these fumes, will  you be sure to cover the hickies on my  neck? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bite marks on my ears? AMBER (slowly turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it doesn't matter, but on my  inner thighs. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Leslie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank rubs his head, then angrily gets out of the truck,

dialogues.speaker: SLAMMING THE DOOR ON ONE OF THE SUSPENDERS ON HIS
dialogues.text: OVERALLS.  He starts to walk, but can't, eventually  leaning out from the truck - only moving his arms as if  walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank, still stuck in the door, is being teased by a GROUP OF KIDS who poke at him with flags and sticks.  ANOTHER  LITTLE KID taunts him with his cotton candy - keeping it  just out of his reach.  Hank bats at them like  Frankenstein and the torch wielding townsfolk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank, still stuck in the door, holds the little kid by  the back of the shirt in one hand and eats the kid's  cotton candy with the other.  The kid struggles to get  away.  A few BROKEN FLAGS are scattered on the ground. HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help...Hank!  Help...Hank!   Help...Hank!  Help...Hank! ON SWAN FLOAT.  Gladys approaches. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I designed the float, you know.   And, what's gonna happen here is that  this is going to look like a  glistening lake beneath the swan. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Gladys? GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need more bars! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is -- what? IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid ate a whole pan! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God she can't do anything  by herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBER (to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-yah, this is exactly how I pictured  it.  Chokin' on swan gas. Suddenly, like a gasoline soaked pinata, it EXPLODES! Gladys is thrown back.  Flames.  Screaming.  PANDEMONIUM! Becky doesn't have a chance.  She's a pink taffeta BALL  OF FIRE.  The swan's back eventually collapses taking  Becky into it's burning belly.  INTERCUT WITH MR. HOWARD'S VIDEO. Gladys watches in stunned silence as her daughter and  only chance at State go up in flames.  Suddenly, she

dialogues.speaker: CRACKS
dialogues.text: GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  My Baby!  The swan ate my  baby! (grabbing at burning float)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow-ow-ow!  Get up, Rebecca!  Get outta  there!  We've gotta go to State!  Oh  hot! (she scorches her blouse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, damn.  I like this blouse.   Rebecca!  Get up, angel face.  Time to  go to State!  Ow-ow-ow! Eventually, Gladys tries to climb up on the float.  Iris  pulls her off. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get offa me, you cow! Gladys spins and notices the silent CROWD. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you lookin' at?  Huh?  A whole  God Damn town of losers!  That's what  I'm lookin' at! Crowd reacts.  Gladys notices Amber and runs up to her  car. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!  You piece-a-shit trailer trash!   This shoulda been you!  Damn, I  shoulda killed you when I had the  The crows reacts again.  Gladys spins, noticing someone. Lester approaches. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ted, sorry.  I didn't know your  family was in the garage when I set it  on fire! LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys!  Stop it! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it wasn't a garage sale as much  as it was a bake sale.  Ah- hahahahahahahaha! Lester tries to pull her away from the crowd. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go-a-me, you old bastard! She grabs a BURNING 2X4 off a float and starts swinging  it. GLADYS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you've got another daughter. CROWD GASPS.  Then stunned SILENCE.  CAMERA CIRCLES  Gladys and Lester getting reaction shots of the crowd. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So help me, Gladys. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky was my only shot at state! LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough! GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!  Let go of me.  Oh my God,  it's COPS! TWIN OFFICERS, followed by "COPS" TV CREW, run up and  aggressively tackle Gladys.  As the struggle on the  ground continues, crew guys go over and shake hands with  the "COPS" crew - obviously knowing them. GLADYS (cont'd) (pointing to Lester)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sells reproductions!  His  furniture's as fake as my orgasms! The COPS crew begins to mingle with the DOCUMENTARY crew. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, how're you doin'? DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!  What's up, Scott?  You remember  Bruce, right? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time, no see. DOCUMENTARIAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, that's Roy. (they shake hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely hillside.  A PASTOR and TOWN FOLK - heads bowed -  stand beside a FRESH GRAVE. PASTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why, dear Lord, it's with such  great sorrow that we turn over to you  a young woman whose dream of ridin' on  a giant swan brought about her  untimely death.  Maybe it's your way  of telling us to buy American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral is over.  Amber, Loretta, Iris and Servettes  awkwardly face each other beside the grave.  Iris takes  the PARTIALLY MELTED TIARA from the headstone. IRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As, uh, actin' President of the Mount  Rose Civil Servettes, it's my duty  since Becky can't fulfill her duties -  kcause she's dead-n-all - to make you  Mount Rose American Teen Princess. She puts the TIARA on AMBER.  Loretta FLASHES pictures. MALE REPORTER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around and let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annette, Amber (wearing her tiara) and Loretta are  leaving the crowning ceremony.  All are happy as they  push an extremely drugged Annette out of the cemetery. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I just didn't wanna win  like this. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stop right there.  You are a good  person.  Good things happen to good  people. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's pure bullshit, sweetie.   You're lucky as hell, so you might as  well enjoy it.  Let's get you a root  beer float. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you guys want some shots?  I'm  buyin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber sits on the picnic table.  In the b.g., Loretta  exits her trailer with a FED-EX GUY.  She pats his buns  as he exits.  She approaches Amber with a packet. AMBER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never liked her, but she didn't  deserve to die in the belly of a swan  like that.  The whole thing's just  kinda sad and lame at the same time. LORETTA (handing over packet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This came for you, sweetie. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!  It's from State!  Oh my God! Amber rips it open and holds up a color brochure with  COLLEEN and TERRY in a glamour shot on the cover. AMBER (cont'd) (paging through packet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all the stuff I get to do.  Oh my  God, oh my God... Okay, okay... We get  a "personal consultation" with a make- up artist -- Eeeh!  Okay, um, there'll  be a choreographer to the stars and,  oh no -- No way.  Oh... My... God! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  For chrissakes, spit it out. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be stayin' overnight at... The  Airport Howard Johnsons! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right by the airport - Oh, Amber... AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an indoor swimming pool!   Ahhhh! Loretta joins in the screaming. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh crap - I only got four days.  I  gotta practice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE BEGINS over MUSIC. Amber emerges from Loretta's trailer, Pop Tart in mouth,  book bag in hand.  SMILES.  WAVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taps her way down the road, out of the trailer park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber scrapes trays.  PAN DOWN.  She wears tap shoes,  practices her routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber walks around the room in high heels, balancing a  bedpan on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber dances around the room, using a suit on a hanger as a partner.  A naked old man is on the embalming slab, a  sheet covering his nasties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In silhouette, Amber taps on the picnic table by the  light of the FULL HARVEST MOON.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE LETTERS ON BLACK
dialogues.text: We look up at the towering Howard Johnsons and see a huge banner which reads: "WELCOME AMERICAN TEEN PRINCESS,  FRIED CLAM PLATTER $9.99." Suddenly, a 747, not more than thirty feet above the hotel, flies over - the sound is  deafening. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, say "Airport Ho-Jo." AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airport Ho-Jo! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it!  Yeah, why don't ya take a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Larson unloads Amber's luggage from the hearse.   Loretta leans against it, arm around Amber, smoking and  occasionally flipping off people who stop to stare at  this unusual sight. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta, don't do that. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  They're just starin'. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta work with these women. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sweetie, that's all right.   Let's go.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a fake tropical look, with loads of plastic  palms, etc.  CAMERA FOLLOWS Amber into area.  BANNER:

dialogues.speaker: "STATE FINALS
dialogues.text: ACADEMY" Contestants (25) sit at tables, they seem more  mature, more professional.  Amber smiles and gives a  little wave.  Terry approaches Amber. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are... AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mount Rose American Teen Princess. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, you don't look dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen and Terry address the assembled contestants.

dialogues.speaker: MINNESOTA MODELING ACADEMY
dialogues.text: COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay ladies, listen up.  I'm Colleen  Douglas and this raving beauty on my  right --  TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a mirror. COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correction.  This spunky monkey on my  right is Terry Macey.  And we are your  Minnesota American Teen Princess State  Board. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're also the co-founders of the  Minnesota Modeling Academy.   Applications are at the tiki bar.   We'll wave the fifty dollar  application fee if you list a friend  and put her address. COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta, seated at the bar, puts her arm around a man  next to her. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...you're cute.  Oh, I see you're  married. (to bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You catch this in your mouth, I'll  give you a present.  All right?  Open  wide... (she throws the olive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, you got that on the first  try.  Come here. Loretta kisses the bartender. LORETTA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Due to budgetary cutbacks - and the  fact that Nationals didn't cough up a  damn nickel this year - you won't be  stayin' overnight.  So pay attention,  you've got about eight hours until  showtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISCO BEAT POUNDS from a boom box.  Mr. Melchoir, the  choreographer, watches contestants move in fast-paced  crisscrossing formations.  Amber is among them.  Miss St. Paul screws up. MR. MELCHOIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember to count, ladies.  Cross on  the left and arms up on eight!  On the  beat!  On the beat!  Keep on it!  Keep  movin' it!  C'mon, Miss Forest Lake,  take that stick out of your ass or I  will.  All right.  Very nice.  Now  come on, arms out.  We're in the front  row.  Come on, sell it!  That's very  nice.  Remember, figure eights,  ladies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen and Terry smoke and drink at a tall tiki table  that's covered with empties.  In the b.g., a pageant  worker passes out PINK BAGS to the contestants.  All the  while, TWO FAT KIDS play "Marco Polo" in the pool. COLLEEN (tipsy, holding up glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can sum up our entire philosophy  with this glass.  I look at it and  say, "it's half full."  Which, in the  beauty pageant biz means, "Where the  hell's my waiter!" She laughs hard, then spins around in her chair. COLLEEN (cont'd) (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop with the fuckin' Marco-Polo  before I rip your fat little heads  off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very mature Miss Burnsville talks to Amber who is  staring at Miss Burnsville's supernaturally well- supported chest. MR. MELCHOIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Burnsville, you're up next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber sits addressing the camera.  Miss Burnsville is  gone. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell anyone, but, I have a  little secret weapon of my own. Amber pulls out a jar of Vaseline from her purse and  smiles innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contestants hungrily fill their plates with seafood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber stands beside the buffet, holding only a salad. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't eat shellfish.  Mom always  says, "Don't ever eat nothin' that can  carry its house around with it - who  knows the last time it's been  cleaned."  She should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber eats at a tall tiki table with Miss Minneapolis. MISS MINNEAPOLIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I've done about thirty-five  pageants.  I guess my most memorable  one'd have to be Miss Teen America,  1995.  It was in Vegas.  My roommate  did Adam West.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: MISS MINNEAPOLIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said he was sooo horny. Amber stares at her with wide-eyed disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber watches four contestants in a row practice their  talents.  All are equally amazing.   "THEME from 2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY" starts.  Miss  Minneapolis steps ON STAGE - silver unitard, silver  streamers, silver tap shoes.  She starts a TAP ROUTINE  that RIVALS AMBER'S. AMBER (whispering to camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  Look at her, she's  awesome.  I should just go home now. Terry and Colleen stand in front of the stage. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, that's enough - I get it.   SUDDENLY Miss Minneapolis FREEZES. MISS MINNEAPOLIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - oh my God... (doubling over in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go! She runs off toward the RESTROOM. COLLEEN (calling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're gonna have to do  somethin' with those nerves before  Nationals.  Thirty-million people  aren't gonna wait while you run to the  john. Other waiting contestants suddenly double over, ad- libbing "oh no! oh my God!"  "I'm gonna puke!" etc.  More contestants grab their bellies.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: FEMALE REPORTER (hand on earpiece)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, a beauty pageant turned ugly.   A salmonella dysentery outbreak, now  traced to improperly refrigerated  shellfish, was believed to be the  cause.  Joining us now is David  Richardson, a member of the  documentary crew filming the pageant.   He was there when tragedy struck.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION SET
dialogues.text: CREW GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' beauty queens blowin' chunks  everywhere.  I've never seen anything  like it before, and I live in L.A. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ed. FEMALE REPORTER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell us any thing about the  controversy?  Is there a controversy  here?  Has there been sabotage? Follow REPORTER as she runs over to Amber, Colleen and  Terry.  All three look dazed.  Reporters SHOUT questions. COLLEEN (with forced sobriety)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, people - wait, wait a minute,  here.  Uh, while we haven't ruled out  sabotage from neighboring state  pageants - Iowa, Wisconsin, North  Dakota... TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dakota. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohio... COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bitch from... TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisconsin. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then. COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bitch. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The important thing is that we have a  winner... PULL BACK to reveal we're:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mayor and other vets, watch Amber on the TV. COLLEEN (ON T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, on behalf of the Minnesota  Modeling Academy, we proudly present  Amber Atkins.  Your new Minnesota  American Teen Princess. The place ERUPTS in CHEER!  ON TV: Terry sets a tiara on  Amber's head.  FLASHES. MAYOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah, ain't it just a kick in the  fuckin' ass!?!?  I'll be a snake's  prick if tragedy and pageants ain't  got a way of bringin' folks  together... (directly at camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yous boys tell me when want me to  start, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber?!  What-the-hell's goin' on  around here?  I'm Mount Rose American  Teen Princess. Where the hell's my  tiara?  I bet those sneaky little Japs  took it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cathy and other townsfolk are glued to a small TV set on  the counter. FEMALE REPORTER (ON T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber, how do you feel? AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh... I feel like... I, uh, I need  a shower. Townsfolk laugh and cheer. CATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus-Mary-n-Joseph I hope Gladys  Leeman hangs herself in her cell when  she hears this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROUGH HAND HELD FOOTAGE.  We see Gladys walking around,  holding onto the back of a large black woman's belt. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.  No, no.  Gosh, no.  You know  I still don't want to be on camera...

dialogues.speaker: WOMEN'S FACILITY
dialogues.text: GLADYS (V.O. ON THE PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah - I just wanna say - that little  bitch better watch her back at  Nationals kcause I'm makin' friends on  the inside... Yah-friends who have  friends on the outside... FEMALE PRISONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your sweet ass off the bunk,  Cinnamon. GLADYS (V.O. ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go. Click.  DIAL TONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annette (left arm's been amputated and replaced with  metal pincers which she hasn't mastered yet) sits at the  picnic table with Amber and Loretta.  Throughout the  following, Annette struggles to open a beer can which  keeps flying out of her pincers.  (Handmade  "congratulations" posters cover the lawn and trailer.) AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just, I just can't believe it.  I'm  Minnesota's American Teen Princess! LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our baby's going to Nationals!   Lincoln, Alabama - look out! AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be on TV!  Just like Diane  Sawyer. Annette opens a beer with a new HOOK replacing her hand. LORETTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annette, just use your hand.   ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me to practice. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, ready?  Here's the signal I'm  gonna give Ma when I'm on TV. Amber MIMES inhaling a cigarette and Annette embraces  her. ANNETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little Carol Burnett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of a corn field.  The "runaway" is a gravel path cut between rows of corn.  A FOUR-SEATER plane is on the runway, in front of a group of town folk with hand- made "good luck" signs.  Amber (in Minnesota sash and  tiara) and the Mayor stand beside the plane.  (NOTE: The  plane never moves.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR (into bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she is, Minnesota's American Teen  Princess - soon to be the next  America's American Teen Princess - our  little Amber! ZOOM IN ON AMBER as PEOPLE cheer Amber on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant Sarah Rose Cosmetics logo on the wall greets  Amber.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN, ALABAMA.
dialogues.text: The CONTESTANTS, including Amber, look around for the  directory.  It reads: FOR LEASE.  A sign at the front of  the building reads: SEIZED.

dialogues.speaker: SEIZED BY THE IRS FOR TAX EVASION...
dialogues.text: As the CAMERA catches the reactions of our contestants -

dialogues.speaker: PAGEANT WAS CANCELED...
dialogues.text: We STOP on MISS OKLAHOMA.  She SCREAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the contestants run out the building...

dialogues.speaker: OF THE MANY YOUNG WOMEN WHO WERE ITS HEART AND SOUL...
dialogues.text: Contestants THROW and HURL suitcases and items through  the glass of the building.

dialogues.speaker: OF THE TITLE...
dialogues.text: The contestants TEAR DOWN the Sarah Rose Logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very perky Leslie Miller, with very big hair, stands  out front in a white lab coat.  She smiles and waves to  camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COLOR PHOTO of slightly less perky Leslie, wearing go- go boots and a smile, dances in a cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lovely shot of the front window

dialogues.speaker: FROM A DEER TICK BITE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, HANK, buck naked, runs back and forth past the  window, spanking himself and waving "hi."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY HOWARD is being helped into a van with "Lutheran  Children's Orphanage" painted on the side.  She looks  sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP of a newspaper photo of Gladys.

dialogues.speaker: PAGEANT...
dialogues.text: The banner and hat she wears read: MINNESOTA 2ND PLACE,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys, wearing Army Fatigues and brandishing a semi- automatic rifle aimed at the FOOD SHACK, holds off a  S.W.A.T. team. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on out, you little blonde piece  of trailer park trash!

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL NEWSCAST
dialogues.text: Female reporter is on the scene of the Gladys Leeman  stand-off outside the food shack.  We see Amber, Annette  (with hook hand) and other town folk behind her, watching the action.  "LIVE" flashes on screen.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: FEMALE REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here in the sixth hour of a  shoot-out between Gladys Leeman - MAN AT FOOD SHACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! The female reporter suddenly stiffens and falls over.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE BULLET.
dialogues.text: Amber steps under the police barricade, over Pat's body,  takes the mic and continues the newscast.  She's a  natural. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Amber Atkins reporting live  from the Food Shack for...KRLH News.   One of our reporters has just been  shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber, now looking like a Midwestern news anchor, sits  with a BLOND MALE ANCHOR.  A LOGO in B.G. reads: TV WAZB

dialogues.speaker: TWIN CITIES.
dialogues.text: BLONDE NEWS ANCHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Peter Aitchison. AMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm Amber Atkins for WAZB News. SUPER: ...was given her job. AMBER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. As they smile and laugh, we:
